title: Mauricio Pochettino rules himself out of replacing Luis Enrique as new Barcelona boss
text:
Comments MAURICIO POCHETTINO to Barcelona? Is it a load of bull – or not? 
The Tottenham boss tried to play down talk of him replacing Luis Enrique at the Camp Nou – but stopped short of ruling himself out of the job. Reuters 5 Spurs chief Pochettino says he is already with one of the biggest clubs in Europe 
And Pochettino went out of his way to correct a misunderstanding which had led some people to think he would NEVER consider going to Barca because of his time as a player and manager at city rivals Espanyol. 
Keep up to date with ALL the Tottenham gossip and transfers on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
Earlier this year Pochettino was asked about the Barcelona job and was quoted as saying he was born with a bull in his arms. 
That was taken by some to mean that he was such an Espanyol man that he could not think of going to Barca – even though the bull is not an Espanyol symbol. 
But Pochettino said: “What I’m trying to explain is that I know very well the business, the football. Reuters Luis Enrique has announced he will leave his job as Barca boss this summer News Group Newspapers Ltd 5 Pochettino believes he still has plenty to roar about as Tottenham manager 
“Because when I was born, it’s true – my mum and my dad put not a bull, a BALL in my arms. 
“It’s a metaphorical example to say that I understand football, the business. I understand that my name will be on a list. 
“I can only say that I am happy here. I understand the business and I can understand that my name is on some list, like if I go and there appears some list of managers who are at other clubs. It’s normal in football today.

But is it flattering to be mentioned as a candidate for one of the biggest jobs in football? 
Pochettino said: “I just understand that we are in one of the biggest clubs in Europe, because for me Tottenham is one of the biggest clubs. 
“You can see that we play very good football, we’re an exciting team, very good players so it’s normal that we’ve called the attention of the rest of the clubs, of football people around the world. 
“We are one of the exciting teams to watch but I don’t take it as flattering.
